title: Stipa richardsonii - spreading needlegrass
description: Stipa richardsonii growing in an open dry montane meadow or parkland surrounded by forests comprising mostly Douglas Fir (Pseudotsuga menziesii). Spreading needlegrass is a somewhat common bunchgrass in this area of open vegetation especially on gravelly substrates where the vegetation has a shorter stature. This site lies along the main gravel road just west of Burley Peak between Sapphire Village and Checkerboard, central eastern Little Belt Mountains, Judith Basin County, Montana.
label: Original
